jobs_results.title: Android Developer Kotlin
jobs_results.description:
An Android Developer is required to work on a globally used French dating application with a unique concept of real-time geolocation. The app has been launched in 2014 and boasts over 126 million registered users worldwide, primarily utilized in Western Europe and South America.
Key Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Develop Android applications using Kotlin, Compose, and RxJava.
‚Ä¢ Implement clean architecture principles (TDD, etc.) for efficient coding practices.
Requirements
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in Android development, specifically in Kotlin.
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with UI/UX design principles through Jetpack Compose.
‚Ä¢ Experience with reactive programming using RxJava.
‚Ä¢ Implementation of clean architecture patterns.
‚Ä¢ Fluency in French language.
About the Role

This position is suitable for ambitious individuals seeking career advancement opportunities in a collaborative team environment. A strong portfolio showcasing expertise in Android development and passion for innovation will be beneficial.

jobs_results.title: Android Developer Kotlin
jobs_results.description:
About the Job

We are seeking an experienced Android Developer to join our team at {company}, a leading developer of innovative mobile applications.

The successful candidate will be responsible for designing and implementing high-quality features for our globally popular dating application.
Key Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Design, develop, and maintain high-performance Android apps using Kotlin.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and prioritize feature development.
‚Ä¢ Work closely with our design team to ensure seamless user experiences.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ Proven experience in developing Android applications using Kotlin.
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with French language and culture.
‚Ä¢ Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Estimated Salary Range:

$85,000 - $110,000 per annum, depending on location and experience.
Job Description: Minimum 500 words

About Our Company

{company} is a technology company that specializes in creating innovative mobile applications. Our flagship product is a popular dating application used by millions worldwide. We are committed to delivering exceptional user experiences through cutting-edge technology and design.

Why Join Us?

As an Android Developer at {company}, you will have the opportunity to work on a wide range of exciting projects, collaborate with a talented team of developers, and contribute to the growth and success of our company. If you are passionate about mobile app development and are looking for a challenging and rewarding role, we encourage you to apply.

Location:

The ideal candidate will be based in Western Europe or South America, with a preference for Argentina or Brazil.

jobs_results.title: Middle/Senior Mobile Flutter Software Engineers
jobs_results.description:
This a Full Remote job, the offer is available from: Europe, Belarus, Poland, Kazakhstan

We are looking for experienced Middle/Senior Mobile Flutter Software Engineers to join our core product ‚Äì BOSS Revolution.

You have a chance to work with a team of outstanding professionals on a challenging product.

You will never be bored‚Äîour team is dynamic, as are our products. Be ready to face thrilling professional challenges and use your strong hard and soft skills to solve them as a Team player.

Your primary responsibility is end-to-end development and support of our user experience in our customer-facing apps.

Join us if you want to:
‚Ä¢ Have a unique work experience with a really strong engineering team!
‚Ä¢ Become a part of a multinational and cross-functional team.
‚Ä¢ Boost your career with a big international product company and have new growth opportunities.
‚Ä¢ Work on new innovative features and bug fixes in a Scrum Team.
‚Ä¢ Take responsibility for the full software development life-cycle.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with business stakeholders and be a part of the product development team.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrate your technology-agnostic positive attitude with the ability to learn and desire to implement solutions using various technologies.
‚Ä¢ Work on high-performing, mission-critical, scalable, and resilient applications and services.
‚Ä¢ Drive aggressive technical debt reduction in close collaboration with developers and automation test engineers.
Join us, if you have:
‚Ä¢ Have around one year of Flutter cross-platform development experience.
‚Ä¢ Have 5+ years of hands-on mobile development experience (Android and/or iOS).
‚Ä¢ Are truly passionate about mobile development.
‚Ä¢ Can communicate in English (B2+).
‚Ä¢ Are a constant learner.
You can please us with:
‚Ä¢ Experience in configuring mobile CI pipelines.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge and experience beyond mobile stack.
We offer you:
‚Ä¢ An exciting and challenging job with talented people around.
‚Ä¢ Really good hardware (a laptop with 32 GB RAM and 512 GB SSD).
‚Ä¢ Competitive salary and growth opportunities.
‚Ä¢ Remote work opportunity (with the opportunity to work from offices in Minsk and Warsaw).
‚Ä¢ Superb English lessons.A few words about us:

IDT Corporation is a global communications company founded in 1990 and headquartered in Newark, New Jersey. We are industry leaders in prepaid communication and payment services and one of the largest international voice carriers. We are listed on the NYSE, employ over 1800 people across 20 countries, and have over $1.5 billion in revenues.

We are not ‚Äùanother big IT corporation‚Äù‚Äî we encourage and support in-house entrepreneurs in developing their ideas into business actions.

Our flagship brand, Boss Revolution, offers Money Transfer, International Calling, and Mobile Top-Up services and supports IDT‚Äôs mission of enabling people to keep in touch and share resources with family and friends worldwide.

If you are here, it seems like you are interested, so let‚Äôs chat! üòâ

jobs_results.title: Software Engineer - Android
jobs_results.description:
Imagine if there was something we could all change today that would reduce global warming by 10% - That‚Äôs how much food waste contributes to the climate crisis, and yet we continue to waste 40% of all the food produced.

Our app connects consumers to surplus food from local restaurants and grocery stores, such as pastries, fresh produce, sushi and more, which would otherwise be thrown away.

Too Good To Go is looking for an Android Developer to join our company, working within our Retail Technologies Solution, focusing purely on the FoodMemo platform, to effectively support retailers in reducing in-store food waste(e)This comes after the exciting announcement that we have recently acquired CodaBene, A French Tech start-up, with the same mission as us; fighting food waste!

The role

As a Senior Android Developer, you will participate in all stages of the creation of our application, these include:
‚Ä¢ Development of our native Android application (Kotlin)
‚Ä¢ Maintenance and continuous improvement of our architecture
‚Ä¢ Writing unit tests
‚Ä¢ Choice of technologies and libraries to implement
‚Ä¢ Definition of UI and UX in collaboration with the product team
‚Ä¢ Implementation and transmission of best practices within the Android Dev team

Tech Stack
‚Ä¢ Android SDK
‚Ä¢ Jetpack Compose
‚Ä¢ Kotlin
‚Ä¢ Architecture MVVM
‚Ä¢ AppCenter
‚Ä¢ Git (BitBucket)

Requirements
‚Ä¢ Proven experience in an Android Development position.
‚Ä¢ Experience with relational database and SQL language management
‚Ä¢ Having strong human and interpersonal qualities
‚Ä¢ Is hungry to make a difference.
‚Ä¢ Enjoys actively participating in a cross-functional product team.

What we offer
‚Ä¢ A rare opportunity to work in a social impact company (and certified B Corporation!) where you get to wake up every day knowing you‚Äôre achieving positive change.
‚Ä¢ The experience of being part of an international company with 1200 + enthusiastic and highly talented teammates across 17 countries (and counting) ‚Äì always ready to share knowledge and support!
‚Ä¢ Strong personal as well as professional development in an intense and high-growth scale-up environment.
‚Ä¢ An open company culture where you have the independence and room to unleash your creativity.
‚Ä¢ A strong team culture where successes are celebrated together.

Interested...

Now that we have caught your attention, it is time for you to catch ours(e)Please make sure to include your English resume and a simple 1-page cover letter telling us why you are the right fit for us(e)All applications are continuously evaluated by real people!

Our values:

# We fight together: food waste is a big beast to fight(e)We can do it if we fight together as Waste Warriors with no ego(e)We believe in a #oneteam.

# We raise the bar: we always push for more(e)We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.

# We keep it simple: our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.

# We build a legacy: we‚Äôre proud of the change we‚Äôre driving.

# We care: we always look out for each other(e)Caring is also about the way we do business(e)We do the right thing.

How to apply

We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above(e)Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.

Submit your CV and Cover letter in English telling us why you are the right fit for this position.

Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform(e)No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.

Job Ref: #LI-RS1

A Movement for Everyone
We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together(e)With that mission, it‚Äôs only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way(e)We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we‚Äôre allowed to be ourselves, and we‚Äôre committed to a culture where all of us belong.
We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need(e)If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

jobs_results.title: Sr. Android Engineer
jobs_results.description:
Fingerprint empowers developers to stop online fraud at the source.

We work on turning radical new ideas in the fraud detection space into reality. Our products are developer-focused and our clients range from solo developers to publicly traded companies. We are a globally dispersed, 100% remote company with a strong open-source focus. Our flagship open-source project is FingerprintJS (20K stars on GitHub).

We have raised $77M and are backed by Craft Ventures (previously invested in Tesla, Facebook, Airbnb ), Nexus Venture Partners (previously invested in Postman , Apollo.io, MinIO , Druva) and Uncorrelated Ventures (previously invested in Redis, Rollbar &Gradle ).

Who We Are Looking For: We are looking for a Senior Android Engineer with a solid background in Information Security. The ideal candidate will have experience building Android applications or libraries from scratch and will be skilled in security frameworks, cryptography, and network protocols. The role requires strong expertise in Kotlin, and familiarity with Jetpack Compose is preferred.

Key Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Design, develop, and optimize native Android applications and libraries, focusing on security, scalability, and performance.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement security protocols and ensure that applications align with best security practices.
‚Ä¢ Build developer tools that enhance productivity and streamline the development process.
‚Ä¢ Contribute to the maintenance and advancement of security frameworks for mobile applications.
‚Ä¢ Provide mentorship to junior team members and contribute to their technical development.

Requirements:
‚Ä¢ Education: Degree in Computer Science, Information Security, or equivalent experience.
‚Ä¢ Experience:
‚Ä¢ 5+ years as a Senior Android Engineer (prior experience in a Senior Android role is required).
‚Ä¢ Strong Information Security background, with practical experience in:
‚Ä¢ Network protocols and secure coding practices
‚Ä¢ Cryptography and security framework development
‚Ä¢ Proven experience in building Android applications from the ground up, with expertise in Kotlin and vanilla Android SDKs. Experience with Jetpack Compose is preferred.
‚Ä¢ Experience with Android NDK is a plus.
‚Ä¢ Contributions to Open Source projects on GitHub are a bonus.

Offers vary depending on, but not limited to, relevant experience, education, certifications/licenses, skills, training, and market conditions.

Due to regulatory and security reasons, there‚Äôs a small number of countries where we cannot have Fingerprint teammates based. Additionally, because Fingerprint is an all-remote company and people can join our workforce from almost any country, we do not sponsor visas. Fingerprint teammates need to be authorized to work from their home location .

We are dedicated to creating an inclusive work environment for everyone. We embrace and celebrate the unique experiences, perspectives and cultural backgrounds that each employee brings to our workplace. Fingerprint strives to foster an environment where our employees feel respected, valued and empowered, and our team members are at the forefront in helping us promote and sustain an inclusive workplace. We highly encourage people from underrepresented groups in tech to apply.

If you are applying as a resident of California, please read our CCPA notice here

If you are applying as a resident of the EU, please read our GDPR notice here

Android Developer

We are seeking an experienced Android developer to join our team and contribute to the development of a globally used French dating application.
About the Role:
‚Ä¢ Design and implement features for our mobile app using Kotlin, Compose, and RxJava
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure clean architecture and adherence to best practices (TDD)

What We Offer:

How to Apply:

Please submit your resume and a cover letter explaining why you would be a great fit for this role. We look forward to hearing from you!

jobs_results.title: Staff Mobile Engineer
jobs_results.description:
Back Market is the world‚Äôs leading refurbished electronics marketplace with a team of 650 people, powering operations in 21 countries (and counting!).

Named one of the World's Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company in 2019 and again in 2021, our mission is simple: empowering people to consume tech sustainably by offering folks a high quality, accessible, and more eco-friendly alternative to buying new electronics. Why? Refurbished tech helps lower our collective environmental impact. We have indeed contributed to avoid the production of more than 1,000,000‚ÄØtons of CO2e worldwide since our launch in 2014.

Be part of an exciting and growing international adventure that will change the way the world consumes tech.

The role & responsibilities

Back Market is looking for a Staff Mobile Engineer to play a pivotal role in our strategic app-first approach set for the upcoming year. Our goal is to enhance user engagement by accelerating the development of innovative features and optimizing the overall app experience.

As a Staff Mobile Engineer, you will be at the forefront of our mobile engineering efforts. You will be instrumental in aligning, designing, and driving the architectural vision for our mobile platforms & app features.

Mobile engineers come from different cultures, backgrounds, and working environments. They are spread across Europe (Spain, France, Germany). Each squad is composed of pairs of iOS & Android engineers, working on the native language to build the best experience for our users.

You will collaborate with other product squads & stakeholders, along with the Mobile Core squad (Platform) that is providing the foundations & infrastructure for your developer experience on apps. That‚Äôs why we are also in favor of having mobile engineers from product squads contributing to technical & core projects from time to time. It‚Äôs not only user experience but tech excellence.

Your expertise in native platforms (major iOS or Android), combined with your ability to make strategic decisions and communicate effectively across all levels of the organization, will be key to driving our mobile engineering success. You will assist in ensuring that tasks are appropriately delegated, decisions are made judiciously, and information flows transparently within the company.
What you will do :
‚Ä¢ Lead the delivery of high-quality iOS & Android code (significant experience in one of these platforms), setting benchmarks for excellence and scalability, thereby propelling our app's capabilities and product cycle velocity.
‚Ä¢ Elevate the development of advanced app-first features, by emphasizing iOS & Android platforms innovation, bridges, and actively building expertise within the mobile engineering community at Back Market.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with a cross-functional team of iOS & Android engineers, as well as peers from various disciplines (SRE, Backend, Frontend, CyberSec, Data, etc.), to foster a culture of technical excellence and shared knowledge.
‚Ä¢ Take ownership & anticipating significant technical projects, managing dependencies both internally and externally, to realize the engineering and product visions.
‚Ä¢ Drive the user experience forward by partnering with Product Managers & Designers, implementing intuitive UI animations, transitions, and accessibility features, while ensuring adherence to our Design System.
‚Ä¢ Architect robust and efficient code patterns, by leveraging the latest iOS & Android technologies, while maintaining a commitment to the app architecture principles, like modularity and dependency injection.
‚Ä¢ Advocate for efficient testing methodologies, from unit and UI tests to cutting-edge end-to-end practices, ensuring the highest quality and reliability of the features developed.
‚Ä¢ Monitor app performance meticulously, utilizing tools like Datadog and Crashlytics to track UI and core functionality, and implement strategies to prevent regressions.
‚Ä¢ Act as an internal spokesperson for the mobile engineering stack, advocating for technical initiatives internally, and representing Back Market at external tech events, conferences, and meetups, while also contributing to the broader tech community through articles and continuous learning
Must have skills and experience
‚Ä¢ 7+ years of relevant and broad mobile engineering experience
‚Ä¢ Strong technical leadership with multiple teams, ability to build and drive mobile engineering vision & engineering excellence
‚Ä¢ Technical expertise in building and scaling native apps on iOS or Android (B2C), with high traffic, weekly features delivery & resolving complex issues
‚Ä¢ Experience successfully operating in a multi-module architecture
‚Ä¢ High knowledge and advocacy of Apple and Google UI guidelines, Swift & Kotlin languages, and mobile platforms‚Äô frameworks.
‚Ä¢ Proven track record for mentoring and developing engineers
‚Ä¢ Good written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present complex technical information clearly and concisely to a variety of audiences.
WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US ?

- A meaningful job: you will help avoid thousands of tons of electronic waste and fight against planned obsolescence. It counts!
- A meaningful company: we became a mission-driven company in January 2022.
- Be part of a worldwide growing company based in Europe, the USA and Asia to face great challenges : you will have the freedom to innovate and adopt new ideas!
- Work alongside passionate experts: who will share their knowledge and help you develop and grow in your career.
- Grow your career: with a flexible career path and a dedicated Learning & Development team. Back Market will help you evolve with personalized internal trainings and external handpicked providers from day 1!
- Leadership Academy by Back Market:‚Äúbe a coach not a dictator‚Äù is at the core of this program ! We train and enable all our leaders to support their team towards achieving goals. Be a manager at Back Market is an unique experience we take by heart.
- An attractive salary, equity and a host of benefits including : Lunch voucher, health insurance, relocation package, paid time off for activism in your community, parental benefits, flexible hours, etc‚Ä¶
- One Loving Tribe: you will have the opportunity to work in a fast-paced, open-minded and friendly environment.
- Be part of one of our Employee Resource Groups createdaround shared identities, common backgrounds and/or special interests crafted to be a safe space and an expressive outlet.
- Several internal events: The Monday Brief (weekly)/ The Somehands (monthly)/ The All Hands (annual).
- We‚Äôre here to SABOTAGE: It‚Äôs our mantra. It keeps us focused on what we aspire to be: a little bit sneaky, always smart, kinda frugal and constantly conspiring to create maximum impact.

Back Market is an Equal Opportunity Employer which means we pledge to not discriminate against employees based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetic information.. If reasonable accommodations are needed for the interview process, please do not hesitate to discuss this with the Talent Acquisition Team.

Back Market is helping to address one of the biggest challenges of our time: climate change. We take this so seriously that we were awarded status as a ‚ÄúSoci√©t√© √† Mission‚Äù, or company with a social mission, by the French government. We know we can‚Äôt tackle a global problem without a globally representative team so we are committed to embedding diversity, equity and inclusion principles in every aspect of our organization. But more importantly, being One Loving & Free Spirited Tribe is in our DNA as it is one of the five foundational values of our company since we got started way back in 2014. We are committed to hiring and supporting diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We know our lofty goals cannot be reached unless everyone has a seat at the table along with the resources and opportunity to grow.

jobs_results.title: Mobile Application Developer (m/f/d)
jobs_results.description:
This a Full Remote job, the offer is available from: Germany, France

Do you want a job with a purpose?

And do you want to make healthcare safer, better and more reliable?

Join our Team!

We are looking for you, located in Trier, Vienna, Bordeaux or 100% remote in Germany, Austria, France as a

Mobile Application Developer (m/f/d)

Your tasks are:
‚Ä¢ Design and implement state of the Art Mobile Applications for iOS and/or Android
‚Ä¢ Deliver re-usable application components in collaboration with our R&D Teams
‚Ä¢ Prototyping
‚Ä¢ Define and design new products as well as incremental re-work of current products.
‚Ä¢ Prepare and conduct user testing together with product managers and UX
‚Ä¢ Work with both local and international product teams.
‚Ä¢ Mentor less experienced team members in App Development

You‚Äôll bring in:
‚Ä¢ Bachelors degree in computer science and/or information systems or an equivalent combination of education and/or experience
‚Ä¢ More than 5 years of working experience
‚Ä¢ Strong know how in Android or iOS App Development with Swift and/or Kotlin
‚Ä¢ Basic Knowledge in one of the following programming languages: Java, PL/SQL, Typescript
‚Ä¢ Practical experience in development of enterprise or complex applications on mobile devices
‚Ä¢ Experience in setting up CI environments.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge in usability engineering and software ergonomics are beneficial.
‚Ä¢ Strong oral and written English language skills

What we offer:
‚Ä¢ Permanent employment contract with attractive salary for a long-term perspective
‚Ä¢ Flexible working hours and working time models ‚Äì for a good work-life-balance
‚Ä¢ Home office incl. TicketPlusCity card from Edenred

‚Ä¢ Regular activities and social events in the team, at the site and in the organization

Be part of our innovative power and shape the future with us!

#teamdedalus #together4success #dedalusgroup

We are looking forward to receiving your online application!

Severely disabled applicants will be given special consideration if they are equally qualified.

Dedalus HealthCare GmbH

Human Resources

54294 Trier

jobs_results.title: Mobile Software Engineer French Geolocation Expert
jobs_results.description:
We are looking for an experienced Android Developer to join our team at Opus Recruitment Solutions. As a leading recruitment agency, we specialize in placing top talent with exciting projects around the world.
Company Overview

Our client is a renowned dating application with over 126 million registered users worldwide. Launched in 2014, it has become a staple in Western Europe and South America, particularly in Argentina and Brazil.
Job Description

As an Android Developer on this project, you will be working on a unique geolocation-based concept that requires real-time location sharing. Your primary responsibilities will include developing high-quality mobile applications using Kotlin and other relevant technologies.
Required Skills and Qualifications

To succeed in this role, you should have:
‚Ä¢ At least 3 years of experience in Android development with a strong focus on Kotlin.
‚Ä¢ Proficiency in Java or other relevant programming languages.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of geolocation APIs and their implementation in Android apps.
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with Agile development methodologies and version control systems like Git.
Benefits

As a valued member of our team, you can expect:
‚Ä¢ A competitive salary of ¬£60,000 - ¬£80,000 per annum, depending on your level of experience.
‚Ä¢ A comprehensive benefits package, including health insurance, retirement planning, and paid time off.
‚Ä¢ Ongoing training and professional development opportunities to enhance your skills and career prospects.

Please note that these figures are estimates based on industry standards and may vary depending on your individual circumstances.

jobs_results.title: Senior Software Developer
jobs_results.description:
Ingenico is the global leader in payments acceptance solutions. As the trusted technology partner for merchants, banks, acquirers, ISVs, payment aggregators and fintech customers our world-class terminals, solutions and services enable the global ecosystem of payments acceptance. With 40 years of experience, innovation is integral to Ingenico‚Äôs approach and culture, inspiring our large and diverse community of experts who anticipate and help shape the evolution of commerce worldwide. At Ingenico, trust and sustainability are at the heart of everything we do.

Scope

This role is based at Valence, right next to the Valence TGV station (Valence TGV), which makes it very easily accessible by train (36 minutes from Lyon Part Dieu ...) !

As a Senior Software Developer, you are part of a development team, participating in the various development activities for Android terminals. Depending on your profile and your skills, you focus on components for our Android Application framework to ease the development of applications in Android terminals or you focus on components for Middleware part for Android terminals. You work in collaboration with the requesters, architects, and peers.

Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Analyze requirements from customers of the team, draft technical solution, participate to development of feature, contribute to the test effort, either by writing automated tests or executing manual test campaign
‚Ä¢ Define the development plan, focus on target with a high quality following the recognized quality standard by the community / team
‚Ä¢ Define the global picture and deep into details, identify impact on other components of the systems and help define efficient solutions regarding customer requests thanks to your experience & expertise, with a good balance between the customer expectation & the complexity of the solution
‚Ä¢ Participate in the documentation for the various deliverable done by the team - internal documentation for the team or documentation for the customer
‚Ä¢ Contribute to the maintenance of the deliverable done by the team by supporting our customers and fix issues raised by the customers
‚Ä¢ Act as the technical referent for project manager, product manager, manager, and customer regarding the status on the software project you are leading. (You may also supervise development of peers and give relevant technical feedback on peer's development to improve the global quality of the deliverable of the team)
‚Ä¢ Act as the technical referent / maintainer for one or several components
‚Ä¢ Stay up to date regarding the technology in the domain and be always one step forward regarding persons using this technology
‚Ä¢ Enable actions to improve the work environment, the software project schedule & quality

Profile

You have a Master's degree in Compter Science or equivalent and at least 6/8 years of experience in relevant software development functions. You' re fluent in French and English. You are familiar with management and reporting tools (Jira, Confluence, BI, ‚Ä¶) and have experience in the payment domain.

Important technical skills :

For a Senior Software developer on Android Application framework
‚Ä¢ Strong experience in Kotlin
‚Ä¢ Programming languages: Java, Python
‚Ä¢ Build system: gradle, gradle plugins
‚Ä¢ Android SDK, Jetpack libraires
‚Ä¢ Clean architecture
‚Ä¢ Kotlin multiplatform
‚Ä¢ Dependency injection
‚Ä¢ iOS development knowledge

For a Senior Software developer on Android Middleware
‚Ä¢ Strong experience of C/C++ programming language (embedded system focus, toolchain), Java, Python and Rust programming language
‚Ä¢ Strong experience of Android internal and customization of Android for specific embedded device and experience of the build process of Android system
‚Ä¢ Use of Linux OS for day-to-day activities and development

For both profiles
‚Ä¢ CI/CD: Jenkins, Bitbucket, Artifactory, Git, Sonarqube
‚Ä¢ Testing tools: Junit, UIAutomator, Robot framework, Robolectric
‚Ä¢ Mentoring software developer to help increasing the expertise of colleagues.

Other important skills :
‚Ä¢ Autonomous to stay up to date regarding the technology in the applicable domain.
‚Ä¢ Master the various development language / technologies required to perform the mission and master the various areas where he is a referent.
‚Ä¢ Strong analytic skills & structured
‚Ä¢ Excellent team spirit and good collaboration skills, able to easily communicate with colleagues within and outside of his team.
‚Ä¢ Solution & customer-oriented focus

.
